name: Barbara Fantechi
content:
Barbara Fantechi is an Italian mathematician. Her research area is algebraic geometry. She is a professor at SISSA in Italy.
 In 2018, Fantechi received the Prof. Luigi Tartufari award from the Accademia dei Lincei.[1]
 Fantechi received her Laurea from the University of Pisa in 1988. Her doctoral advisor was Fabrizio Catanese, after whom the Catanese surface is named.[2]

Italian mathematician
Barbara FantechiBorn1966NationalityItalianAlma materUniversity of Pisa,AwardsProf. Luigi Tartufari awardScientific careerFieldsAlgebraic GeometryInstitutionsSISSA, ItalyDoctoral advisorFabrizio Catanese

Barbara Fantechi is an Italian mathematician. Her research area is algebraic geometry. She is a professor at SISSA in Italy.
In 2018, Fantechi received the Prof. Luigi Tartufari award from the Accademia dei Lincei.[1]

Education[edit]
Fantechi received her Laurea from the University of Pisa in 1988. Her doctoral advisor was Fabrizio Catanese, after whom the Catanese surface is named.[2]
